Mandatory medication name coded using a SNOMEDCT/dm+d term where possible, allowing plain text for historical/patient reported items , extemporaneous preparations or those not registered in dm+d.

Episodicity is used within a primary care context to distinguish between ongoing and new episodes of a problem or diagnosis, primarily for public health or quality assessment purposes.

In episodic care contexts (commonly  secondary care) it is common to categorise/ organise problems according to their relationship to the principal problem or diagnosis being addressed during that episode of care. These categories may also be used for clinical coding, reporting and billing purposes.

Details of the nature of supplementary information that is to follow e.g name of laboratory results.
The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service. This is also referred to as Placer Order Identifier.
The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.

The status of the request for service as indicated by the requester. Status is used to denote whether this is the initial request, or a follow-up request to change or provide supplementary information.
Current Activity.
Identification of the examination requested. This is often coded with an external terminology.
A detailed narrative description of the examination requested.
A short description of the reason for the request.  This is often coded with an external terminology.
A narrative description explaining the reason for request.
Stated intent of the request by the referrer.
Urgency of the request.
The date and time that the service should be performed or completed.
The latest date that is acceptable for the service to be completed.
True indicates that additional information has been identified and will be forwarded when available eg incomplete pathology test results.
Details of the nature of supplementary information that is to follow e.g name of laboratory results.
The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service. This is also referred to as Placer Order Identifier.
The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.

The status of the request for service as indicated by the requester. Status is used to denote whether this is the initial request, or a follow-up request to change or provide supplementary information.
Any event.

Specific identifier for this lab test. e.g. Full blood count , blood glucose, urine microbiology.  May equate to the result name for a single value result. Commonly a coded term e.g from LOINC or SNOMED-CT.
The type of high-level diagnostic service e.g. biochemistry, haematology.
The status of the lab test as a whole.
Values Validation: Interim; Final; Supplementary; Corrected (amended); Aborted; Never performed
SNOMED codes or subset ID: Interim (local::at0037)| Final (local::at0038)| Supplementary (local::at0039)| Corrected (amended) (local::at0040)| Aborted (local::at0074)| Never performed (local::at0079)

Data item Description: The result of the test.
An overall interpretative comment on this test.
Representations of the whole test in mutlimedia e.g image, audio, video.
The local ID assigned to the order by the order requester. Equivalent to the Placer Order Identifier.
The local ID assigned to the test order by the order filler, usually by the (LIS) Laboratory Information System. Equivalent to the DICOM Accession Number and the Filler Order Identifier.
The identifier given to the laboratory test result of a pathology investigation.
The date and/or time that the result was issued for the recorded ‘test status’.
Any event.

Identification of the imaging examination or procedure performed, typically including modality and anatomical location (including laterality). Coding with a terminology, potientially a pre-coordinated term specifying both modality and anatomical location, is desirable where possible. Possible candidate terminologies: LOINC, SNOMED CT or RadLex.

The imaging method used to perform the examination e.g Ultrasound, CT, X-ray. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible. If the modality is specified by a code in the Examination result name, then this field is not required.
The status of the examination result as a whole.
Values Validation: Registered; Interim; Final; Amended; Cancelled / Aborted
SNOMED codes or subset ID: Registered (local::at0009)| Interim (local::at0010)| Final (local::at0011)| Amended (local::at0012)| Cancelled / Aborted (local::at0013)

Data item Description: The date and/or time that the result was issued for the recorded 'Examination result status'.
Description of clinical information available at the time of interpretation of results, and which may a link to the original clinical information provided in the examination request.
Narrative description of findings, including comparative findings.

A group of structured results. Results may be grouped by anatomical location or by some other name or code to describe what binds all the results together. If a name or code is used, it is provided by run-time re-naming of the 'Result group' element or may be fixed in a specialised archetype or template. Coding with a terminology, potentially a pre-coordinated term including specimen type, is preferred where possible for the name. Should be coded with LOINC or SNOMED CT.

Specific detailed result, including both the value of the result item and additional information that may be useful for clinical interpretation. Results include whatever specific data items imaging services report as part of the clinical service; it may include measurements. These are often referred to as 'Structured Findings'. The result is identified by run-time re-naming of the 'Result group' element or may be fixed in a specialised archetype or template. Coding with a terminology, potentially a pre-coordinated term including specimen type, is preferred where possible for the name. Should be coded with LOINC or SNOMED CT. Examples include cardiac ejection fraction or bone density.
Actual value of the result. Most result values will be numerical measurements, but others may be coded concepts or free text.

May include statements about significant, unexpected or unreliable 
values, or information about the source of the value where this may be relevant to the interpretation of the result.
Single word, phrase or brief description representing the 'Conclusion'. Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Concise and clinically contextualised narrative interpretation of the imaging examination findings.
Rich text representation of the entire result as issued by the diagnostic service. Multiple formats are allowed but they must be semantically equivalent.

Additional narrative about the examination not captured in other fields. For example, recommendations for future examinations; a comment on appropriateness of the examination or on quality of images, if separate to findings; or a note that the film was given to the patient.

Details concerning a single examination requested. Note: Usually there is one examination request for each result, however in some circumstances multiple examination requests may be represented using a single Imaging examination result archetype.
The local identifier assigned to the order by the order requester. Equivalent to the HL7 Placer Order Identifier.
Identification of imaging examination or procedure requested, where the examination requested differs from the examination actually performed.
The local identifier assigned to the examination order by the order filler, usually by the Radiology Information System (RIS). Usually equivalent to the HL7 Filler Order Number.
Unique identifier of this study allocated by the imaging service.
The local identifier given to the imaging examination report.

Images referred to, or provided, to assist clinical understanding of the examination. If attached image is in DICOM format, all the fields below should be populated so the values are available to software that does not process DICOM images.
Unique identifier of this image allocated by the imaging service (often the DICOM image instance UID).
Unique identifier of this series allocated by the imaging service.
The name of the imaging view e.g Lateral or Antero-posterior (AP). Coding using a terminology is desirable, where possible.
Description of the subject of care's positon when the image was performed.
Specific date/time the imaging examination was performed.
An attached or referenced image of a current view.
Details of previous images used for comparison.
The local identifier assigned to the order by the order requester. Equivalent to the HL7 Placer Order Identifier.
Unique identifier of this study allocated by the imaging service.
Unique identifier of this image allocated by the imaging service (often the DICOM image instance UID).
Unique identifier of this series allocated by the imaging service.
The name of the imaging view e.g Lateral or Antero-posterior (AP). Coding using a terminology is desirable, where possible.
Description of the subject of care's positon when the image was performed.
Specific date/time the imaging examination was performed.
An attached or referenced image of a current view.
The summary, assessment, conclusions or evaluation of the clinical findings.
The summary, assessment, conclusions or evaluation of the clinical findings.
